Generation II.Gold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
Generation II.Silver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
Generation II.Crystal: When it is in danger, its tail uses some sort of mysterious powers to drive away the enemy.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Girafarig 's rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pok é mon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
Generation III.Sapphire: Girafarig 's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
Generation III.Emerald: A Girafarig is an herbivore--it eats grass and tree shoots. While it is eating, its tail makes chewing and swallowing motions as if it were also eating.
Generation III.FireRed: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.
Generation IV.Pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.
Generation IV.Platinum: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.

Generation VI.X: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.
Generation VI.Y: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Girafarig's rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Girafarig's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its tail has a separate small brain. The tail bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on the Pokémon from behind.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
Generation IX.Violet: Girafarig’s tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokémon from behind.
